Promise-aware lapply

Similar to base::lapply(), but promise-aware: the FUN function is permitted to return promises, and while lapply returns a list, promises_lapply returns a promise that resolves to a similar list (of resolved values only, no promises).

promise_lapply(X, FUN, ...)

Arguments

X

A vector (atomic or list) or an expression object (but not a promise). Other objects (including classed objects) will be coerced by base::as.list.
FUN

The function to be applied to each element of X. The function is permitted, but not required, to return a promise.
...

Optional arguments to FUN.

Details

promise_lapply processes elements of X serially; that is, if FUN(X[[1]]) returns a promise, then FUN(X[[2]]) will not be invoked until that promise is resolved. If any such promise rejects (errors), then the promise returned by promise_lapply immediately rejects with that err.

[[1]: R:[1 [[2]: R:[2

Examples

# NOT RUN {
# Waits x seconds, then returns x*10
wait_this_long <- function(x) {
  promise(~later::later(~{
    resolve(x*10)
  }, delay = x))
}

promise_lapply(list(A=1, B=2, C=3), wait_this_long) %...>%
  print()
# }
